app.text_info: This app is created by Iris (@Jeann11 on GitHub) and Coral (@coral2742 on GitHub). Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures.
app.text_acknowledge: This quick app is an open-source project about places in Ireland in San Patrick's Day powered by open data and enriched by the community. Most of the information was extracted from Wikidata, OpenStreetMaps, and other public sources. You can find inaccuracies, so we apologize in advance.
app.text_feedback: Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures. This app is created by locals and experts.

pois.name: Killary Sheep Farm, County Galway
pois.description: In spring the landscape of Ireland, teeming with wildlife, is a true beauty of vivid colors and changing textures. But one of our favorite sights is the rolling green hills dotted with newborn, cotton-white lambs.

pois.name: Armagh’s Home of St Patrick’s
pois.description: St Patrick’s Festival returns with an exciting programme of music, art, theatre, film and dance. This is a chance to reflect on the legacy of St Patrick and have fun celebrating his influence on history and culture.

pois.name: Dublin Bay
pois.description: Dublin is a highly social place, bursting with culture, creativity and craic (fun). Dublin Bay, a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Go hiking in the Dublin mountains, scale at Dalkey Quarry, hike the cliff path in Howth or join Dublin's toughest locals for a swim in the sea whatever the weather.

pois.name: The Guinness Storehouse
pois.description: Dublin is a highly social place, bursting with culture, creativity and craic (fun). Dublin Bay, a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Go hiking in the Dublin mountains, scale at Dalkey Quarry, hike the cliff path in Howth or join Dublin's toughest locals for a swim in the sea whatever the weather.

pois.name: St. Patrick's Day Festival, Dublin
pois.description: The St. Patrick's Day Festival in Dublin is one of the biggest celebrations of the year in Ireland. The city comes alive with music, dancing, parades, and fireworks.

pois.name: Cliffs of Moher, County Clare
pois.description: The Cliffs of Moher are one of Ireland's most iconic landmarks, and offer breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. They are located on the west coast of Ireland and are a popular destination for visitors all year round.

pois.name: The Brazen Head, Dublin
pois.description: The Brazen Head is one of Ireland's oldest pubs, dating back to 1198. It is located in Dublin and offers traditional Irish food, live music, and a cozy atmosphere.

pois.name: Dog's Bay Beach, County Galway
pois.description: Dog's Bay Beach is a beautiful white sand beach located in County Galway. It is surrounded by stunning scenery and is a popular spot for swimming, surfing, and sunbathing.

pois.name: Rock of Cashel, County Tipperary
pois.description: The Rock of Cashel is a historic site in County Tipperary, featuring a collection of medieval buildings and ruins, including a 12th-century round tower, a 13th-century Gothic cathedral, and a 15th-century castle

pois.name: The Temple Bar, Dublin
pois.description: The Temple Bar is a popular pub located in the heart of Dublin's cultural quarter. It is known for its lively atmosphere, traditional Irish music, and extensive selection of Irish whiskies.

pois.name: Galway City
pois.description: Galway City is a vibrant and cultural city in the West of Ireland. On St. Patrick's Day, the city comes alive with colorful parades, traditional Irish music, and plenty of Guinness flowing in the pubs.

pois.name: Grafton Street, Dublin
pois.description: Grafton Street is a pedestrianized shopping street in the heart of Dublin. On St. Patrick's Day, the street is filled with performers, street vendors, and revelers decked out in green and shamrocks.
